what-it-does: Checks for operations that compare a name to itself.
why-is-this-bad:
Comparing a name to itself always results in the same value, and is likely
a mistake.
example:
foo == foo



In some cases, self-comparisons are used to determine whether a float is
NaN. Instead, prefer math.isnan:


import math

math.isnan(foo)

example-split.example-before:
foo == foo



In some cases, self-comparisons are used to determine whether a float is
NaN. Instead, prefer math.isnan:


import math

math.isnan(foo)
